You say that like Minecraft ever needed to be online

Survival games are, almost without exception, better with friends. If two or more friends cannot be on at the same time for whatever reason, or want to interact with other random people on the internet (at their own risk) the dedicated server becomes a necessary component of that equation. THe downside however is with any PvP survival game, the presence of the dedi server creates PvO (player vs offline). The more challenging the PvP, the more PvO takes place. (good example: ARK survival evolved)
I play both. My biggest project.

That's like asking what's better, chicken or steak. Except steak is clearly the correct answer.

Let me start again.

The two games are way to different for one to be better than the other. Also, by the time I'd found out about KSP I was burned out on Minecraft. I don't know how they'd have stacked up if I came across them at the same time.

Survival games are, almost without exception, better with friends. If two or more friends cannot be on at the same time for whatever reason, or want to interact with other random people on the internet (at their own risk) the dedicated server becomes a necessary component of that equation. THe downside however is with any PvP survival game, the presence of the dedi server creates PvO (player vs offline). The more challenging the PvP, the more PvO takes place. (good example: ARK survival evolved)

SP is fine for me, though the occasional co-op is nice too. I dislike that everything fun somehow has to be tied into the online and cloud movement. Some things are very good when savoured, explored one step at a time, at your own pace and leisure.

Minecraft. There's a creative server I've been playing on since September 2012, and am going to play on it for the entire foreseeable future. My favorite thing about the server is that it's one of ten servers that hasn't been infected with either the Minigame Virus or the Survival Games virus. But, my favorite game in general is Trainz Simulator 12.

Excuse me for asking, and sorry if you're ticked by this, but how insane are you to recognize all those colored ASCII characters as a world? I've tried DF a few times and every time, right around 10 minutes in, just after I give up trying to figure the thing out, I get a splitting headache from the interface and just delete the thing.
